metadata.title: CVE-2024-22025 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: A vulnerability in Node.js has been identified, allowing for a Denial ofService (DoS) attack through resource exhaustion when using the fetch()function to retrieve content from an untrusted URL. The vulnerability stemsfrom the fact that the fetch() function in Node.js always decodes Brotli,making it possible for an attacker to cause resource exhaustion whenfetching content from an untrusted URL. An attacker controlling the URLpassed into fetch() can exploit this vulnerability to exhaust memory,potentially leading to process termination, depending on the systemconfiguration.

criterions.comment: nodejs package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
